sen.j: 山背部小田（やましろべのおだ、生年不詳 - 文武天皇2年（698年）12月）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: YAMASHIROBE no Oda is a person who lived in the Asuka Period, and died in December, 698.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: YAMASHIROBE no Oda is a person who lived during Japan's Asuka Period and died in January, 699.
YAMASHIROBE no Oda (year of birth unknown - January, 699) is a person who lived during Japan's Asuka Period.
sen.cmt: 生年不詳 の部分が分割されていたのでここにまとめました。

sen.j: 山代小田（やましろのおだ）とも書く。
sen.e: His name also spells YAMASHIRO no Oda.
His name 山背部小田 is also written as 山代小田.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記をのこしました。
sen.e: His name 山背部小田 is also written as 山代小田.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは、前者が「やましろべのをだ」、後者が「やましろのをだ」。
sen.e: commentつけました
In the old Japanese kana syllabary, the former kanji characters are pronounced "YAMASHIROBE no Oda" while the latter are "YAMASHIRO no Oda."
sen.cmt: ふたつの表記では「べ」の有無が違うので訳出しました。「を」はOにしています。
sen.e: In the old Japanese kana syllabary, the former kanji characters are pronounced "YAMASHIROBE no Oda" while the latter are "YAMASHIRO no Oda."

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）に従い、東海道に軍の動員を命じる使者になった。
sen.e: During the Jinshin War in 672, Yamashirobe took side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, who later became Emperor Tenmu), and became a messenger to mobilize troops from the Tokaido region.
During the Jinshin War of 672, Yamashirobe took side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, who later became Emperor Tenmu), and became a messenger to mobilize troops from the Tokaido region.
sen.cmt: 前置詞を修正しました。
sen.e: During the Jinshin War of 672, Yamashirobe took side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, who later became Emperor Tenmu), and became a messenger to mobilize troops from the Tokaido region.

sen.j: 山背部については不明。
sen.e: commentつけました
sen.cmt: なにが「不明」なのか不明です。
sen.e: The origin of the Yamashinobe clan is unknown.
sen.cmt: 現在のWeb表記から、この氏族の出自が不明という意味と思われるのでそのように訳しました。
sen.e: The origin of the Yamashinobe clan is unknown.

sen.j: 壬申の乱を起こした大海人皇子は、6月26日までに美濃国と伊勢国が味方についたことを知った。
sen.e: Oama no Miko, who broke out the Jinshin War, learned by June 26 that the Provinces of Mino and Ise decided to take Oama's side.
Oama no Miko, who caused the Jinshin War, learned by June 26 that the Provinces of Mino and Ise decided to take Oama's side.
sen.cmt: broke out を causedに修正しました。
sen.e: Oama no Miko, who caused the Jinshin War, learned by June 26 that the Provinces of Mino and Ise decided to take Oama's side.

sen.j: そこで伊勢国朝明郡の郡家から、さらに東海（東海道）と東山（東山道）の軍を発するための使者を遣わした。
sen.e: Then, Prince Oama dispatched messengers from Kori no miyake (public office) in Asake no Kori in the Province of Ise to mobilize troops from the Tokaido and Tosando regions.
Then, Prince Oama dispatched messengers from Kori no miyake (public office) in Asake no Kori in the Province of Ise to mobilize troops from the Tokaido and Tosando regions.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Then, Prince Oama dispatched messengers from Kori no miyake (public office) in Asake no Kori in the Province of Ise to mobilize troops from the Tokaido and Tosando regions.

sen.j: 山背部小田と安斗阿加布が東海への使者になった。
sen.e: YAMASHIROBE no Oda and ATO no Akafu were sent to the Tokaido region.
YAMASHIROBE no Oda and ATO no Akafu were sent to the Tokaido region.
YAMASHIROBE no Oda and ATO no Akafu were sent to the Tokaido region.

sen.j: 彼等は無事に任務を果たしたらしい。
sen.e: They seem to have performed their assignment without failure.
They seem to have performed their assignment without failure.
They seem to have performed their assignment without failure.

sen.j: 『続日本紀』文武天皇2年（698年）12月30日に、勤大弐の山代小田に直広肆の位を贈ったとする記事がある。
sen.e: In Shoku Nihongi (Chronicle of Japan Continued), there is an article dated December 30, 698, which says YAMASHIROBE no Oda, ranked "gon dai ni," was honored with "jiki koshi" cap rank.
sen.cmt: 勤大弐＝ゴンダイニ直広肆=ジキコウシ
sen.e: In "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), there is an article dated December 30, 698, which says YAMASHIROBE no Oda, ranked "gon dai ni," was honored with "jiki koshi" cap rank.
sen.cmt: 原文に『』があるので""を追加しました。
sen.e: In "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), there is an article dated December 30, 698, which says YAMASHIROBE no Oda, ranked "gon dai ni," was honored with "jiki koshi" cap rank.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』と『続日本紀』で、このような位階贈与記事は、壬申の功臣の死亡時に設けられる。
sen.e: In Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan) and Shoku Nihongi (Chronicle of Japan Continued), articles on provision of cap ranks appear when meritorious retainers of the Jinshin War died.
In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), articles on provision of cap ranks appear when meritorious retainers of the Jinshin War died.
sen.cmt: 原文に『』があるので""を追加しました。
sen.e: In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), articles on provision of cap ranks appear when meritorious retainers of the Jinshin War died.

sen.j: 山代小田は山背部小田と同一人で、この日かその少し前に死んだと推測できる。
sen.e: YAMASHIRO no Oda is seen the same person as YAMASHIROBE no Oda, and is believed to have died on the day or slightly before.
It seems reasonable to assume that YAMASHIRO no Oda was the same person as YAMASHIROBE no Oda and died on that day or a little while before.
sen.cmt: 「推測できる」を文全体にかかるようにしました。
sen.e: It seems reasonable to assume that YAMASHIRO no Oda was the same person as YAMASHIROBE no Oda and died on that day or a little while before.
